title: Nick Bosa gets back at Baker Mayfield for Oklahoma's 2017 upset of Ohio State in Columbus
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Week 5 had revenge games and shocking upsets. Lorenzo Reyes delivers this weeks power rankings and biggest risers and fallers. USA TODAY

SANTA CLARA, Calif. — Nick Bosa just had to bring some extra heat for Baker Mayfield.

And it went beyond trolling the Cleveland Browns Browns quarterback by mimicking the “plant the flag” gesture after one of his two sacks during the 31-3 romp on Monday night. The San Francisco 49ers rookie defensive end also tried to get into Mayfield’s head with some serious trash-talking.

“I don’t usually talk, but this game, yeah, I talked,” Bosa said after having a huge hand in Mayfield’s worst NFL game. “But he didn’t say one word.”

Bosa was surely a man out for some revenge, still mindful of the incident two years ago when Mayfield planted an Oklahoma flag in Ohio State’s home stadium after he led the Sooners to victory.

Yet as the rout unfolded and Mayfield (8-for-22, 100 yards, 0 TDs, 2 INTs) produced a career-worst 13.4 passer rating, Bosa was relentless in mocking the quarterback.

What exactly did he say to Mayfield?

“Baker, Baker,” Bosa said softly, singing the name like a nursery rhyme — or punch line from a horror film. “How are you feeling? I want a challenge.”

In addition to his sacks, Bosa forced a fumble, recorded another fumble was forced by linemate DeForest Buckner, had two of his four tackles result in losses, and was credited with five quarterback hits. In other words, a dominant performance as part of an overwhelming unit.

That Mayfield didn’t verbally respond to Bosa’s attempts to goad him hardly mattered. Bosa sensed that the 6-foot-1 Mayfield, sacked four times, had trouble seeing over the inside rush from D-tackles Buckner and Arik Armstead, who are both listed at 6-foot-7.

“He was double-clutching, going back and forth,” Bosa said, referring to the hesitation he saw in Mayfield as he tried to work through progressions on passing plays. “We had him rattled all game.”

Just as Bosa expected.

“We rush well,” he said of the dominant defensive front. “All four of us. All of the backups. We’ve been rattling all the quarterbacks we play. I just knew he would hold on to it, which we love.”

And Bosa also knew he couldn’t wait to plant the flag ... after planting the quarterback.

description: Nick Bosa was a man out for revenge Monday night, getting back at Baker Mayfield for a 2017 college football game in which Oklahoma upset Ohio State.
